description: Small garden: 1 x cherry (adjacent to T4): crown reduce back to previous, most recent reduction points, retaining furnishing growth and shaping to maintain a natural rounded canopy.1 x holm oak (T7): crown lift as required by 0.5m, lifting fine twiggy branches only.  Remove one low growing branch on north side, with diameter of less than 5cm.1 x laburnum (adjacent to T10): remove or prune back damaged limb and prune back from road as required to ensure clearance for high vehicles.1 x London plane (T10): Crown reduce lateral growth back to previous, most recent reduction points, retaining furnishing growth and shape where required into upper canopy without undertaking a height reduction.Large garden: 1 x London plane (T1 (1)): reduce single low lateral branch growing into canopy of lime T2 (1), by approximately 4-5m, back to previous reduction point. 1 x Lime (T2 (1)): crown reduce to previous, most recent reduction point, retaining shortened furnishing growth and fine branch structure throughout the crown.   Remove epicormic growth to crown break.1 x lime (T2 (2)): Remove 5-6 lowest small diameter branches (those branches that have been previously pruned back to lengths of about 1-2m and which have diameters of between 2-5cm).  Lift any remaining twiggy growth to give 5m clearance over road and 2.5m clearance over footpath.2 x limes (T2 (3) and T2 (4)): crown lift to 5m by removing epicormic growth back to main stems.2 x elms (T4 (4) and T4 (5)): fell2 x small trees (unknown species) adjacent to T5: reduce by up to 30%,  as required to reshape.
decision_conditions: work in accordance with British Standard
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
